tweet: There was clearly one topic that dominated this week in Congress. In my weekly chat video, I review the events that took place. Hope you'll take the time to listen. pic.twitter.com/6usHn1RHC6

REMINDER: The October 4th application deadline is fast approaching for #OK04 HS seniors seeking a congressional nomination to one of the nation's service academies. Click below or call my Norman office at (405) 329-6500 for more details. https://bit.ly/2mFMdDV
Facts matter. And in my opinion, the facts released to date don’t justify impeachment.

As promised & in the interest of transparency, @POTUS released the transcript of his phone call with Ukrainian President Zelensky. After reading the transcript for myself, I don’t think it warrants the grounds for impeachment that Democrats prematurely claimed ahead of release.

Speaker Pelosi & @HouseDemocrats are doing an enormous disservice to the country by recklessly pursuing a partisan impeachment inquiry that puts the priorities of their Caucus ahead of the needs of the American people. Full statement ⬇️ https://cole.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cole-statement-impeachment-inquiry …

Today is #MuseumDay! Oklahoma's museums are numerous and appropriately reflect and celebrate our state's rich history. Consider visiting one during your Saturday today! https://www.smithsonianmag.com/museumday/museum-day-2019/ …

Courtney Gains of #OK04 is an inspiring leader for African American women with disabilities, and I'm honored to advocate on her behalf as a new member of the Congressional Task Force on Down Syndrome. WATCH her interview w/ @OKCFOX:  https://bit.ly/2kwDrHE 
#FourthDistrictFriday pic.twitter.com/dqw8DTpn87
Thank you for the great honor! https://twitter.com/statecommission/status/1175118216286351360 …

This week has been a mixed bag. On a positive note, the House responsibly passed a CR to keep the government open. Disappointingly by contrast, House Democrats also pushed through a misguided bill that's better named the "Trial Lawyers Protection Act." More in my weekly chat! pic.twitter.com/trMgYU9dtq

Thinking of my namesake & late uncle Tom today. As a POW in WWII, he was held in prison camps & forced to walk the Bataan Death March. He kept a booklet (now in my DC office) listing the brave men he met, so he'd never forget them. #POWMIARecognitionDay
 https://www.instagram.com/p/B2or059nWg8  pic.twitter.com/ErXeKcjHOe

September is National Preparedness Month, which is an important reminder to have a plan for staying safe during an emergency, including severe weather that's common in Oklahoma. @Readygov has some valuable resources to help you #beready. #PreparedNotScared  https://www.ready.gov/plan

The continuing resolution passed today not only keeps the government open & vital operations funded, but it also provides critical authorization for some important programs that millions of Americans rely on. 

My full statement: https://cole.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cole-votes-keep-government-open …
Since this day in 1947, @usairforce has valiantly defended our nation through the control and exploitation of air and space. Happy 72nd birthday, #AirForce! #OTD pic.twitter.com/zdWgtmDoJN

On #ConstitutionDay, we celebrate the most important document ever written for securing liberty from the ambition of tyrants. While I am disappointed @POTUS has been forced to direct the deferral of military construction projects in order to secure the border, he is right to do so. I just visited the border, & I agree that efforts to strengthen security must not be delayed. MORE: https://cole.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cole-statement-diversion-funds-border-security …
